intro: Achyronia costulata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed milkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and narrow, elongated leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in summer, followed by seed pods that split open to release fluffy seeds. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in harsh climates. The plant contains toxic alkaloids, which can be harmful to livestock and humans if ingested.
